item.title: Rumor: Fortnite Could Be Crossing Over With Popular Disney Franchise
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Fortnite leak hints at a Monsters Inc. crossover, potentially expanding Epic Games' list of famous IP collaborations.
  • Disney partnerships with Fortnite continue to grow, with upcoming additions from Star Wars and The Incredibles.
  • Fans should take this leaks with caution as details may change.

A new Fortnite leak has revealed that Epic Games' battle royale could be working on a crossover with Pixar's Monsters Inc . Fortnite has a significant list of crossovers with famous IPs inside and outside the gaming world. With this year's edition of D23, Fortnite is further expanding its partnership with Disney.

While Epic Games recently released new Pirates of the Caribbean skins, more content is coming in the next few months. Disney villains are coming to Fortnite for the first time this fall, while more Star Wars characters will get new cosmetics. Even Pixar has been remembered, and it has been confirmed that The Incredibles will be joining Fortnite 's roster of characters, with the release of skins for Frozone, Mr. Incredible, and Elastigirl. Now, a new Fortnite rumor is circulating, and it is reported that another popular Disney IP may be on its way to the game.

Well-known Fortnite leaker Shiina revealed on their Twitter that Fortnite could be working on a collaboration with Monsters Inc . According to the dataminer, the information was shared by the same person who sent them and the also known Fortnite leaker HYPEX, the image of another Fortnite leak related to Disney. According to HYPEX, the collaboration could include Monsters University , while Shiina notes that there is no set date for the release of this potential new crossover between Fortnite and the Pixar franchise.

Fortnite and Monsters Inc. May Team Up in a Future Crossover

Released in 2001, Monsters Inc. is the fourth film produced by Pixar. The film features monsters who work by scaring children to power the Monster World. But the story takes a different turn when James P. Sullivan and his assistant, Mike Wazowski, have to return a human girl named Boo after she enters the monster world. The success of the flick kicked off the Monsters Inc. universe, with the prequel film Monsters University hitting theaters in 2013, and adaptations for other media such as games, animated shorts, and theme park attractions.

Fortnite players should always take leaks with a pinch of salt, as information has the chance to change along the way. It's important to note, however, that the crossover with Monsters Inc. is yet another in the list of recent reports about potential Fortnite collaborations. A leak recently revealed that Fortnite is working on a crossover with The Simpsons , although it didn't give any further details. Among the Disney-related news already confirmed, Fortnite will see the addition of Doctor Doom next season, and the inclusion of even more Marvel-themed cosmetics.

item.title: New York Times Connections: Hints and Answers for #430 August 14, 2024
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #430 for August 14, 2024
  • Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle
  • Answers for Today's NYT Connections #430 for August 14, 2024

Connections is back with another sixteen words. Today's puzzle is challenging enough that you might be in need of help with each of the individual words, help with clues for the puzzle or some of the categories, or you might even need some spoilers or the whole answer to win.

If you already know how to play Connections and are looking for a helping hand, you can find it all below. Since you have such a limited number of mistakes you can make in this puzzle game, some days, you will just want a few clues to get you going in the right direction.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #430 for August 14, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Babe, Buzz, Boo-Boo, Daisy, Jasmine, Mickey, Dance, Yogi, Goof, Sting, Petunia, Flub, Poppy, Lou, Gaffe, and Pollinate.

What is the Definition of Pollinate?

To pollinate, according to Dictionary.com, is "to convey pollen to the stigma of (a flower)."

What is the Definition of Petunia?

Petunias are a type of flower that are native to tropical America. It is also a color that is a darker red/purple color that the flowers are known for having on their petals.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you need hints for this challenging puzzle game, you can find all sorts of them in the sections below. There are things like general clues, specific hints, category help, and spoilers too.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow Connections Category Answer

item.title: Every Alien Game Where The Xenomorph Is Playable
item.description:
Highlights

  • Alien: Romulus brings back Xenomorph terror with staple characters and expanded gamer options.
  • Aliens: Colonial Marines received poor reception due to broken AI coding and promised features missing.
  • Alien franchise fans can now control Xenomorphs in various game titles, including Dead By Daylight.

Audiences are being terrified by aliens known as Xenomorphs yet again with the release of Alien: Romulus . For over 45 years, the Alien franchise has been a staple of the theaters, but also video games with a plethora of tie-ins, and original games that expand the universe created by Ridley Scott and Dan O'Bannon.

Typically, Alien games focus on human characters outrunning or shooting down the Xenomorph menace, but occasionally, developers allow gamers to control said menace. Though not plentiful, there is a collective of video games that feature playable versions of the perfect organism.

9 Aliens: Colonial Marines

Xenomorph Is Only Playable In Multiplayer

Fans of the franchise were excited about Aliens: Colonial Marines because it was hyped as a great sci-fi first-person shooter set after the events of James Cameron's Aliens . Unfortunately, due to multiple promised aspects not present in the final product and broken coding for AI enemy aliens that turned the titular monsters into easy targets, Colonial Marines ended up with a poor reception.

The online multiplayer for Aliens: Colonial Marines allowed players to take control of the Xenomorph hordes and was arguably the superior mode for the game, but sadly, the servers are barren. The only way to get a match in to play as a Xenomorph would be to get a group of friends to create a custom match.

8 Fortnite

In A Battle Royale, No One Can Hear You Rage Quit

As with many other franchises, Fortnite collaborated with Alien to give fans not only Ellen Ripley in her Alien and Aliens variants but also the Xenomorph itself, which was available in the skin pack. There is a nice emote to hear the Xeno let out its famous screech, but other than that, it plays no different from any other Fortnite skin.

It may seem disappointing that Fortnite gives the Xenomorph no unique abilities, but there is a fear factor. Even in the family-friendly art style of Fortnite , the alien creature is still scary enough to instill fear into the player when they see it charging at them with an assault rifle or a shotgun.

7 Alien Vs Predator

It Walked So Other Games Could Run

Often overshadowed by its successors, the 1994 Alien Vs Predator was far ahead of its time as a first-person shooter exclusive to the often-forgotten Atari Jaguar. With digitized actors and props for sprites, the usage of short render distance to create dark levels, and the chance to play all three races, the original title paved the way for future games.

One way that Alien Vs. Predator stands out from the rest is that each playable race has its pros and cons. The Xenomorph is unable to heal, so it must cocoon Colonial Marines and upon dying, it will respawn from said cocoon. With the Marine and Predator having their unique mechanics, it kept the three campaigns from feeling identical and proved Rebellion was perfect for this franchise.

6 Aliens Vs Predator (1999)

The Shooter That Changed Alien Games Forever

When it comes to Aliens Vs. Predator games, most fans think back to the series that started in 1999. Rebellion took the initial concept that was started with the Jaguar game and pushed it to a new level on PC; it was darker, bloodier, and far scarier than any Alien game that came prior.

Rebellion's Aliens Vs. Predator was also much more taxing on the player, with limited save states in each of the three campaigns. As the Xenomorph, the player focuses more on stealth and traversal across walls and ceilings, something that even the best 90s first-person shooters hadn't done before, and even though future games would evolve to do it better, it was still revolutionary.

5 Dead By Daylight

An Expansion Every Survivor Should Fear

Games such as Alien: Isolation prove how terrifying Xenomorphs can be, so that fear somehow gets worse with a player controlling one in Dead By Daylight . With the Alien DLC expansion, gamers can stalk other human players, eliminating them by hanging them on hooks for the Entity like all other Dead By Daylight killers or by using the famous inner mouth attack.

Implementing a mechanic never seen in Alien games, Dead By Daylight harks back to famous scenes in which Xenomorphs can emerge from the walls of their hive. Via a series of underground tunnels, the Xenomorph can traverse and surprise survivors by emerging at many points on the map.

4 Aliens Vs Predator 2

A Big Step Up From Its Predecessor

With more saves, improved controls, and even better levels, Aliens Vs Predator 2 is an example of how a sequel can be superior in almost every way. The Xenomorph campaign is even expanded upon, allowing players to experience the entire life cycle of the famous alien monster.

From a facehugger to a chestburster and into a Xenomorph warrior, Aliens Vs Predator 2 went all out in terms of upgrading the Alien campaign. The Colonial Marine and Predator were given upgrades as well, including even more horror for the Marine campaign. On top of it all, Aliens Vs Predator 2 features a dedicated multiplayer fan with all three species being playable.

3 Aliens Vs Predator: Extinction

An RTS That Anyone Can Enjoy

Akin to the likes of StarCraft , Aliens Vs. Predator: Extinction deviates from the first-person shooter formula of previous games in favor of a real-time strategy game. With Xenomorph, Colonial Marine, and Predator playable once again, the idea is fairly straightforward with building bases, raising armies, and accomplishing missions.

Fans of the Alien franchise can still enjoy the game since Aliens Vs. Predator: Extinction is not too difficult to learn, but longtime RTS players won't feel alienated, since it is far from a cakewalk as well. It may not have the horror that some fans would expect from Alien , but it still delivers the thrills that a good RTS game should provide.

2 Mortal Kombat X

The Alien Was One Of Many Deadly DLC Fighters

Alongside the Predator, Jason Voorhees, and Leatherface in Mortal Kombat X was the Xenomorph. However, rather than just a basic Xenomorph, Netherrealm Studios introduced their own breed mixed with Tarkatan DNA, giving the already dangerous creature arm blades like Baraka.

With three variations focusing on acid, face-hugging, and slashing, the Xenomorph in Mortal Kombat X is one of the more lethal characters to control. Its speed is one of the fastest in the game's roster, and it can attack from almost any range. Guest fighters in Mortal Kombat tend to be fun, but the Alien proved to be a favorite on the whole roster with standout fatalities from the movies.

1 Aliens Vs Predator (2010)

Brief But Bloody And Brutal Reboot

The final time fans would experience Xenomorphs fighting Predators, Aliens Vs. Predator was a reboot of the first-person shooter series still developed by Rebellion. While the three campaigns are surprisingly short for such a big budget release, it does not take away from how fun they are.

Each Aliens Vs. Predator game does something different with the Xenomorph campaign and the 2010 reboot is no different. It was the first game to give the playable Xenomorph an actual story. The campaign follows Specimen 6 from its birth in a Weyland-Yutani lab to becoming the leading warrior in the Matriarch's hive on BG-386, and while it is short, the story is still worth playing.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Players Aren't Happy About Competitive Points Restriction
item.description:
Highlights

  • Overwatch 2 fans are frustrated with the limited 3,000 Competitive Points cap introduced in Season 9.
  • Players are upset with reduced point earnings for wins, leading to a longer grind for Cosmetic Weapon variants.
  • A Reddit post sparks backlash against the current system, with many calling for a return to the old point system.

Fans of Overwatch 2 point out the issues with the restriction placed on competitive points that only allows them to earn 3,000 Competitive Points. Their dissatisfaction goes back to the change introduced in Overwatch 2 's Season 9.

At the start of Season 9 of Overwatch 2 , Blizzard introduced a slew of changes to the game, among which was a new way to earn Competitive Points. Players could earn 10 points for a win in a competitive match, five for a draw, and zero for a loss, lowering it from the previous 25 points earned for a win. To offset this, players were given a new type of Cosmetic Weapon variant to purchase from the shop called "Jade Weapons." However, each of these variants costs 3,000 Competitive Points, which is the earning cap for each Overwatch 2 season starting from Season 9.

In a recent Reddit post, an Overwatch 2 player by the username MARiJNiBOii posted a screenshot of their Competitive Points. They point out that they have 2635 points, which means that they have not bought a weapon variant, while a pop-up informs them that they've reached the "maximum competitive points rewards." They go on to say that complications like these are "ridiculous," seeing as the Overwatch 2 Season 9 points rework has made it so that earning points takes far longer than it previously did.

Overwatch 2 Players Call for Old Competitive Points System to Return

This sparked a wave of criticism from other fans who dislike the current point system. Most agreed that the current point system missed the mark, wishing that Blizzard would revert the game back to the old one, while a minority pointed out the only silver lining to this system. Namely, this system battles botting to an extent by restricting bonus progression, since players would still get progress on the progression bar for losses. They argue that restricting competitive points in this way makes botting for competitive points not worth it. One player also mentioned that OP's screenshot could be an Overwatch 2 UI bug, as the only explanation of the problem that started the thread.

The final point of contention players had with the current system was the Cosmetic Weapon variants available for purchase with 3,000 Competitive Points. These include the legacy Golden Guns in Overwatch 2 , which are always available, and the new Jade Guns offered during the current season. Fans in the comments describe the Jade Guns as merely a green recoloring and anticipate that the next season's Cosmetic Weapon variants will simply be a blue or red version. As a result, they don't find them worth the investment.

item.title: Meme Sea: How to Get an Aura
item.description:
Meme Sea is is a Roblox RPG based on the One Piece anime. However, instead of the usual weapons and Devil Fruits, players must use memes. The enemies in this game may look funny, but does not make them less dangerous. So, you need to use all the ways to become stronger.

The Aura ability, which is quite difficult to get in Meme Sea , will help you in this regard. Aura does not give players attacking abilities, but buffs their Strength and Defence stats, so it will make your character much stronger. Here's how to get it in this Roblox game.

How to Get an Aura in Meme Sea

Almost all abilities in Meme Sea can be learned with the help of suitable trainer NPCs, and Aura is no exception to the rule. To get Aura in Meme Sea , you need to find an Aura Master NPC and bring them 10 million Cash and Meme Cube.

You can find this NPC on Forgotten Island. Select this island in the compass menu and get to it by any available means. There, climb to the very top platform and find a large palm tree on the edge. The Aura Master NPC you need will be standing on it. However, finding them is not enough to get Aura in Meme Sea .

Obtaining The Meme Cube

To get the Aura ability from the Aura Master, you will need to bring them a Meme Cube. This is the most difficult part of the quest, since the Meme Cube drops from only one enemy: the Meme Beast. This boss spawns every 30 minutes in the sea near Floppa Island.

The Meme Beast is a level 2000 boss with 1,000,000 HP, so it is quite difficult to defeat it solo, especially if your level is below 1000. Therefore, you will need the help of other players. It is also worth noting that because the boss spawns in the middle of the sea, players using Powers may have difficulties during the battle.

When you defeat the Meme Beast, then, provided you have dealt enough damage, there is a 50% chance you will get a Meme Cube. After that, you need to save up to 10 million Cash and go to the Aura Master NPC to get the Aura ability in Meme Sea .

How to Change Aura Color in Meme Sea

Initially, you have a default Aura color. By visiting the Halfed Sorcerer NPC in the Arena , you can unlock a new color in exchange for Gems. It is important to note that this is only a cosmetic change, and does not affect the ability bonuses. Players can then visit the Aura Colour Storage NPC to select one of the available Aura colors.
